verses.verse: Come down, <S%H3381><s%> and sit <S%H3427><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the dust, <S%H6083><s%> O virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> on the ground: <S%H776><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> throne, <S%H3678><s%> O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans: <S%H3778><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou shalt no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%> tender <S%H7390><s%> and delicate. <S%H6028><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> the millstones, <S%H7347><s%> and grind <S%H2912><s%> meal: <S%H7058><s%> uncover <S%H1540><s%> thy locks, <S%H6777><s%> make bare <S%H2834><s%> the leg, <S%H7640><s%> uncover <S%H1540><s%> the thigh, <S%H7785><s%> pass over <S%H5674><s%> the rivers. <S%H5104><s%>

Thy nakedness <S%H6172><s%> shall be uncovered, <S%H1540><s%> yea, <S%H1571><s%> thy shame <S%H2781><s%> shall be seen: <S%H7200><s%> I will take <S%H3947><s%> vengeance, <S%H5359><s%> and I will not <S%H3808><s%> meet <S%H6293><s%> thee as a man. <S%H120><s%>
As for our redeemer, <S%H1350><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is his name, <S%H8034><s%> the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Sit <S%H3427><s%> thou silent, <S%H1748><s%> and get <S%H935><s%> thee into darkness, <S%H2822><s%> O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans: <S%H3778><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou shalt no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H3254><s%> be called, <S%H7121><s%> The lady <S%H1404><s%> of kingdoms. <S%H4467><s%>

I was wroth <S%H7107><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> my people, <S%H5971><s%> I have polluted <S%H2490><s%> mine inheritance, <S%H5159><s%> and given <S%H5414><s%> them into thine hand: <S%H3027><s%> thou didst show <S%H7760><s%> them no <S%H3808><s%> mercy; <S%H7356><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the ancient <S%H2205><s%> hast thou very <S%H3966><s%> heavily laid <S%H3513><s%> thy yoke. <S%H5923><s%>

And thou saidst, <S%H559><s%> I shall be <S%H1961><s%> a lady <S%H1404><s%> forever: <S%H5769><s%> so that <S%H5704><s%> thou didst not <S%H3808><s%> lay <S%H7760><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things to <S%H5921><s%> thy heart, <S%H3820><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> didst remember <S%H2142><s%> the latter end <S%H319><s%> of it.

Therefore hear <S%H8085><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> thou that art given to pleasures, <S%H5719><s%> that dwellest <S%H3427><s%> carelessly, <S%H983><s%> that sayest <S%H559><s%> in thine heart, <S%H3824><s%> I <S%H589><s%> am, and none else beside <S%H657><s%> <S%H5750><s%> me; I shall not <S%H3808><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> as a widow, <S%H490><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall I know <S%H3045><s%> the loss of children: <S%H7908><s%>

But these <S%H428><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> things shall come <S%H935><s%> to thee in a moment <S%H7281><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> the loss of children, <S%H7908><s%> and widowhood: <S%H489><s%> they shall come <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee in their perfection <S%H8537><s%> for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy sorceries, <S%H3785><s%> and for the great <S%H3966><s%> abundance <S%H6109><s%> of thine enchantments. <S%H2267><s%>

For thou hast trusted <S%H982><s%> in thy wickedness: <S%H7451><s%> thou hast said, <S%H559><s%> None <S%H369><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> me. Thy wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and thy knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> hath perverted <S%H7725><s%> thee; and thou hast said <S%H559><s%> in thine heart, <S%H3820><s%> I <S%H589><s%> am, and none else beside <S%H657><s%> <S%H5750><s%> me.

Therefore shall evil <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee; thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> from whence it riseth: <S%H7837><s%> and mischief <S%H1943><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee; thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> be able <S%H3201><s%> to put it off: <S%H3722><s%> and desolation <S%H7722><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee suddenly, <S%H6597><s%> which thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> know. <S%H3045><s%>

Stand <S%H5975><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> with thine enchantments, <S%H2267><s%> and with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy sorceries, <S%H3785><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> thou hast labored <S%H3021><s%> from thy youth; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5271><s%> if so be <S%H194><s%> thou shalt be able <S%H3201><s%> to profit, <S%H3276><s%> if so be <S%H194><s%> thou mayest prevail. <S%H6206><s%>

Thou art wearied <S%H3811><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy counsels. <S%H6098><s%> Let now <S%H4994><s%> the astrologers, <S%H1895><s%> <S%H8064><s%> the stargazers, <S%H2372><s%> <S%H3556><s%> the monthly <S%H2320><s%> prognosticators, <S%H3045><s%> stand up, <S%H5975><s%> and save <S%H3467><s%> thee from these things that <S%H4480><s%> <S%H834><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee.

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> they shall be <S%H1961><s%> as stubble; <S%H7179><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> shall burn <S%H8313><s%> them; they shall not <S%H3808><s%> deliver <S%H5337><s%> <S%H853><s%> themselves <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of the flame: <S%H3852><s%> there shall not <S%H369><s%> be a coal <S%H1513><s%> to warm <S%H2552><s%> at, nor fire <S%H217><s%> to sit <S%H3427><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> it.

Thus <S%H3651><s%> shall they be <S%H1961><s%> unto thee with whom <S%H834><s%> thou hast labored, <S%H3021><s%> even thy merchants, <S%H5503><s%> from thy youth: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5271><s%> they shall wander <S%H8582><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his quarter; <S%H5676><s%> none <S%H369><s%> shall save <S%H3467><s%> thee.
